TITLE: Extending Filetypes with LuaSnip
DESCRIPTION: This snippet extends the 'ruby' filetype to include snippets from the 'rails' framework when using LuaSnip. It allows for adding additional snippets relevant to specific frameworks to existing filetypes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
require'luasnip'.filetype_extend("ruby", {"rails"})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extending Filetypes with vim-vsnip
DESCRIPTION: This snippet extends the 'ruby' filetype to include snippets from the 'rails' framework when using vim-vsnip. It configures vim-vsnip to load additional snippets for a specific filetype.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: viml
CODE:
```
let g:vsnip_filetypes.ruby = ['rails']
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Excluding Snippets with LuaSnip
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to exclude certain snippets, such as those for javascript, when loading snippets using LuaSnip. This allows you to filter out irrelevant snippets based on language or other criteria.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
-- will exclude all javascript snippets
require("luasnip.loaders.from_vscode").load {
    exclude = { "javascript" },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Lazy.nvim Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure Lazy.nvim to use the 'friendly-snippets' collection. It configures LuaSnip as a dependency to ensure snippets are properly detected and loaded. This helps avoid slower startup times.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
{ "L3MON4D3/LuaSnip",
  dependencies = { "rafamadriz/friendly-snippets" },
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: coc.nvim Installation
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to install the 'friendly-snippets' collection using coc.nvim. It directly installs the snippets from the GitHub repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: vim
CODE:
```
:CocInstall https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets@main
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Packer Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure Packer to use the 'friendly-snippets' collection. It specifies the repository to install the snippets from.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: lua
CODE:
```
use "rafamadriz/friendly-snippets"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: vim-plug Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to configure vim-plug to use the 'friendly-snippets' collection. It specifies the repository to install the snippets from.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rafamadriz/friendly-snippets/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: vim
CODE:
```
Plug "rafamadriz/friendly-snippets"
```
